content.description: Complete the starting first couple of moves of Gone Missing and then traverse right following the crack systems all the way to Campus Problem.
content.location: Same start as Gone Missing V3.

content.description: Start just to the right of the large chimney on the horizontal jug and follow the black slab to the top.
content.location: Farthest right route on the western face of the Trailside Boulder between "Trailside Chimney" and "Gone Missing"
Left of the SW facing chimney in the Trailside boulder.

content.description: Climb excellent jugs up the easy chimney to a clean top-out.
content.location: The obvious chimney in the middle of Trailside Boulder's west face between "Trailside Slab Left" and "Trailside Slab Right"

content.description: This problem climbs the overhanging arete on the left side of the "Trailside Boulder".
content.protection: Crash pad coverage for sharp rocks in drop zone.
content.location: Arete on the northwest corner (left side) of the Trailside Boulder.

content.description: Sit start, move your way up into a right hand side pull 6 feet up from the ground. Cross into a secure hand jam and cruise up the face with small, positive ledges.
content.location: Just to the right of the overhanging arete

content.description: Start seated and match the slanted incut edge. Fire up the sharp crimp, then up to the sloper. Go to the jug out right, then mantle your way to glory! Not sure about the grade, so put in your thoughts for this one.
content.protection: Two pads is fine, just watch out if you roll off the right side
content.location: It’s on the backside of Trailside

content.description: Sit start on crystals at far right of the Dime Crack face, next to the tree. Follow juggy holds straight up to the sloper ramp and topout.
content.protection: Pads, preferably a few. A fall here would be more awkward than most of the others due to the tree and slope.
content.location: Rightmost problem on the same face as Dime Crack

content.description: Start on the far right seam/crack of gone missing. make big move out left to the start of Gone Missing V3. Follow through the preexisting line. This extension will add a pump factor, test your crimp strength and lock off power. The red point crux is the classic throw to the good crimp!
content.location: Find trail side boulder. Then find Gone missing V3.

content.description:
Start underneath the low overhang on a left hand gaston with a good thumb catch, a right hand on a pinch/crimp and a right foot on the prominent feature low and right. Leap straight back and hit the obvious flat jug. If you hold on you can reward yourself with a nice mantle to finish the problem. The hardest part might be avoiding the dab on this short climb.

Alternate beta: either slap out right or use an intermediate left crimp to reach the jug.
content.location: Starts under the overhang on the backside of the Trailside boulder. Just left of The Thing, V1 (7l on the original Chris Dorrity Guidebook).

content.description: High ballin easy up face left of tree.
Sit start and two longer moves that tops out over easy slab.
content.location: Right corner of the Trailside Boulder

content.description: Start on jugs on right end of obvious crack next to tree. Campus start or make use of extremely small feet under overhang, traverse left along crack then up through crimps to the right of the tree to gain top
content.protection: a pad or two, competent spotter. Watch for small snakes while topping out.
content.location: Trailside boulder around to the right of the usual warm up V0's.

content.description: Jump to the first ledge and match on the overhanging edge. Campus throw up and to the left then throw to another jug. Jug haul from there.
content.protection: Might need some pads to stack up to get to the edge.
content.location: The overhanging lip between Dime Crack and Unknown V3.
